abstract: James Ryerson reviews African-American history books Competition in the Promised Land: Black Migrants in Northern Cities and Labor Markets by Leah Platt Boustan, Dark Ghettos: Injustice, Dissent, and Reform by Tommie Shelby and The Revolution Has Come: Black Power, Gender, and the Black Panther Party in Oakland by Robyn C Spencer.

lead_paragraph: New books examine race in America in the time since millions of black migrants moved in hopes of greater opportunity.
snippet: New books examine race in America in the time since millions of black migrants moved in hopes of greater opportunity....

headline.main: Race in America After the Great Migration
